posts.post_content: Time has not been kind to Ali - I guess he's victim to the early design philosophy that creatures' costs should be weighted more towards the abilities than the body. However calling him a 'joke of a card' is unfair. He's hardly an unplayable whelp like [Wood Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wood Elemental) or [Mold Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mold Demon).

posts.post_content:
@ TheWrathofShane: Do you realize you have to play crap like Ali from Cairo and Shield of Kaldra at the expense of actual good cards? Do you realize that even if you cast Ali and protect him, you still have to address the manner of winning the game? If you actually built a deck around winning in a consistent and timely manner, you don't have to run cards that are purely defensive. The point of a game of Magic is to win, rather than simply not lose. What need is there to play Ali from Cairo?
  
   
"why not just shut up and go drown on your own saliva, hows that sound?"
  
   
It sounds like you can't even make an argument to stand behind.
